summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to JP Morgan Chase Bank, demanding extensive financial records related to an investigation into violations including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The subpoena seeks records for Bear Stearns and Co (US) and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, requesting financial records from JP Morgan Chase.

persons.name: Mark Lubin
persons.context: Contact person for questions regarding the subpoena, indicating his role in the financial investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Scheduled date for JP Morgan Chase to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: Date the grand jury subpoena was issued to JP Morgan Chase Bank, initiating the formal demand for financial records.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).

It demands extensive financial records from JP Morgan Chase related to Bear Stearns and Co (US), covering account inception to present, including wire transfers, credit card statements, and correspondence.
The U.S. Attorney's Office specifically requests non-disclosure of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The document indicates a focus on financial trail investigation, seeking records like 'Know your customer' documentation, online banking IP logs, and safe deposit records.
